meanings.definition: A piece of iron or other material that has its component atoms so ordered that the material exhibits properties of magnetism, such as attracting other iron-containing objects or aligning itself in an external magnetic field.
meanings.sent1: The magnet on the fridge held up the picture.
meanings.sent2: The magnet attracted the paperclips effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat batted the magnet off the table.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a magnet, drawing everyone towards her.
meanings.sent5: The magnet's pull was so strong, it seemed almost magical.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that has a powerful attraction or charm.
meanings.sent1: The new restaurant became a magnet for food lovers.
meanings.sent2: The movie star was a magnet for attention wherever she went.
meanings.sent3: The magnet of a story kept the children captivated till the end.
meanings.sent4: His charisma was a magnet that drew people to him effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The melody of the song acted like a magnet, pulling at heartstrings.
